intro: Pedicularis multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered lousewort, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. The plant produces striking, spurred flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, often resembling orchids. Its roots are semi-parasitic, drawing nutrients from the roots of other plants. Pedicularis multiflora thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
